newsitem.title: UK: LIFFE white sugar holds off lows, takes cue from New York.
newsitem.headline: LIFFE white sugar holds off lows, takes cue from New York.

text.p: White sugar futures managed to stave off some of the bearish spill-over from the New York market's slide and struggled to hold above earlier lows in light volume, traders said on Monday.
With a mixed bag of players in London, the whites market took its cue from the raws where interest is expected to be centred before the upcoming March expiry.
The May/May white premium widened from Friday's close to around $67 but remained with the recent $65-68 range.
Broker-led arbitrage was also noted against the Paris May contract with London at par, traders said.
At 1646 GMT May was down $1.20 at $308.00 and August down $1.30 at $307.00. Volume amounted to just 763 lots.
In physical news, Iran's state-run GTC tendered to buy a cargo of white sugar for April shipment after buying a EU-origin cargo last week, again for April.
A strike by warehouse workers at Brazil's key port of Santos is thought to be affecting 90 percent of imports and a smaller percentage of exports.
Some 140 workers are involved in the strike over backpay, which began earlier on Monday and is set to continue indefinitely.
Values were weaker in Paris and the spot May contract was trading down $2.00 at $308.00, the same as its London equivalent. August was down $2.10 at $307.20.
